body.p: The Broker module is used to send events. Edit the configuration file shinken-specific.cfg and modify this module:
body.codeblock: # send into GLPI DB # =============== Work with the monitoring plugin for GLPI =============== define module { module_name glpidb module_type glpidb database glpi ; database name user shinkenbroker ; database user password passshinken ; database password host localhost ; host to connect to }
body.p: The values to change here are:

ul.li: database: name of GLPI MySQL database
password: password of GLPI account (in our example, it's passshinken)
host: IP or name of server where MySQL server is installed.

body.p: The module is defined, now add it in Arbiter configuration:
body.codeblock:
#The broker manages data export (in flat file or in database) #with its modules #Here just log files and status.dat file modules define broker { broker_name broker-1
[...]
modules Livestatus, Simple-log, WebUI, PickleRetentionBroker }
# Additional interesting modules you might want to add: # PickleRetentionBroker: save data when quitting # ToNdodb_Mysql: NDO database support # NPCDMOD: Use the PNP addon # Graphite-Perfdata: Use the Graphite backend for perfdata # WebUI: Shinken Web interface [...]
body.p: So add module and we will have that :
body.codeblock:
#The broker manages data export (in flat file or in database) #with its modules #Here just log files and status.dat file modules define broker { broker_name broker-1
[...]
modules Livestatus, Simple-log, WebUI, PickleRetentionBroker, glpidb }
# Additional interesting modules you might want to add: # PickleRetentionBroker: save data when quitting # ToNdodb_Mysql: NDO database support # NPCDMOD: Use the PNP addon # Graphite-Perfdata: Use teh Graphite backend for perfdata # WebUI: Shinken Web interface [...]
body.p: In a simple implementation, Livestatus, Simple-log and WebUI can be remove on load on line begin by modules.
